mdRecord.dcterms:title: Van Briggle Memorial Pottery, exterior
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Van den Arend, Nicholas (Dutch-American architect, 19th-20th century) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Right wing of pottery in foreground, with the left wing in the distance

Constructed by Anne (Gregory) Van Briggle to commemorate the death of her husband Artus Van Briggle. The pottery changed owners many times and survived fire and floods. The pottery business was moved to another location ca. 1955; original pottery building sold to Colorado College, 1968. Now used as offices and a maintenance facility. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Van_Briggle_Pottery; Noel, The Buildings of Colorado, 1997. [work]
